_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Energy Services, LLC - Macungie Terminal 2BE propane distrubition system and butane railcar storage complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 (most recent edition to the extent feasible) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas storage, and it is this facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Lehigh County LEPC as well as the Lower Macungie Fire Department and Emergency Management Agency, as necessary.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the Lehigh County LEPC, Macungie Ambulance Corps and Lehigh Valley Hospital.  This facility does not maintain a trained fire brigade but does employ a hazardous materials response team and trained incipient stage fire response on-site to respond to small or the initial stages of an emergency.  The Assistant Operations Manager is the Facility emergency contact and the Administrator of this RMP.  All site personnel are trained in the hazards of this process along with the contiguous butane railcar storage as identified in the employee participation plan.



The Macungie Terminal 2BE is a refined petroleum product distributor and wholesaler including propane operations and temporary storage of butane (liquefied under pressure) for use at the adjacent Buckeye Pipe Line Company, LP facility.  The Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the propane storage and distribution system only, including the associated piping, storage vessels, and butane and propane railcars (butane storage for an adjacent facility may occur on the Macungie Terminal 2BE rail spur).



The Facility's Worst Case and Alternate release scenarios have been evaluated with subsequent emergency plans being addressed with the local response agencies.



Buckeye Energy Services, LLC - Macungie Terminal 2BE continues to effort greater interaction with the local First Responders through on-site exercises and training.  The Macung

ie Terminal 2BE is considering revising the current operating procedures to a more uniform corporate format.



The Macungie Terminal 2BE complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68  Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) inclusive of all 14 elements, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  This system is designed, constructed and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Superior Energy Systems, LTD.) instructions.  Process Hazard Analyses revalidations (Checklist), compliance Audits, and subsequent updates have been completed.



This facility has not had an accident within the past 5 years involving this liquefied petroleum gas system which has resulted in deaths, injuries or property/environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Macungie Terminal 2BE propane distribution system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Lehigh County LEPC and the Lower Macungie Fire Department and request their assistance.  The facility currently has no trained fire brigade but does employ a hazardous materials response team and trained incipient fire response group.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated by the fire department and the Lehigh County LEPC along with the Lower Macungie Emergency Management Agency.
